{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3348215,"name":"Prat Prakash","username":"Prat42","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/prat42/{size}/202457_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-31T03:16:22.527Z","cooked":"

Our robot gets disabled frequently in match, and the disables last for 3-5s each. They are randomly spaced out, and in some matches just don’t happen. We are constantly connected to the radio, and all connections between the radio → switch → rio have been thoroughly tested and hot glued. The Rio isn’t resetting, because the communications come back too quick for the 120s it takes for a rio to reboot.

We can’t reproduce these issues in the pit, or on the practice field. Smashing into a wall doesn’t do it either. At home we have the flickering issue which I posted about earlier (which ironically isn’t happening at comp), but no issue like this.

We are running a Rio 2.0, a Brainbox SW-008 ethernet switch, 5Ghz Radio, and Driver Station 24.0.2

Although comms issues are common, I haven’t been able to find a team/post with matching symptoms, and the CSA and FTA at our event also don’t know what it could be. Attached are the driver station logs, and the robot code. Any help is appreciated, as we have DCMP in less than a week, and have no idea where to even start debugging this issue.

Robot Code

Logs from a good match:

image513×814 45.7 KB

Logs from a bad match:

image764×837 65.6 KB

Zoomed in log of disconnect:

image1017×814 31 KB

Team5427/Crescendo at States","clicks":2},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/a/1/a1b8390415dc3855af3b728ecfbfa0994bcc3dee.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/2/2/2241e33127703b0e6cf09b581d155cd98c543fa5.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/1/e/1e4e30bc55110e676e7a8fed7ab02390528a0df6.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60027,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5427 CAD / Prog guy"},"post_url":"/t/more-comms-issues-but-in-a-different-flavor-of-frustrating/460770/1","custom_user_title":"5427 CAD / Prog guy","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3348218,"name":"Jsteel","username":"Jsteel","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/9de053/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-31T03:21:21.325Z","cooked":"

We went through exactly this. Did all kinds of work with static, connections, wiring.

Finally replaced the Brainbiox with another switch. Problem has not reappeared.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-03-31T03:21:21.325Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":384,"readers_count":383,"score":111.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":460770,"topic_slug":"more-comms-issues-but-in-a-different-flavor-of-frustrating","display_username":"Jsteel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24050,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/more-comms-issues-but-in-a-different-flavor-of-frustrating/460770/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3348223,"name":"","username":"person4268","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/22d042/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-31T03:27:00.399Z","cooked":"

The current consensus I’ve heard around (but not experienced despite having the same switch for some reason) is that it’s caused by switch reboots from electrostatic discharge. As unreliable as it has a reputation of being, I have heard using the 2nd radio port as a mitigation (so at least you can still drive the robot) but I’d personally explore other options like trying to mitigate the static buildup or finding a less susceptible switch. I’m not sure what any of those routes would entail.

Wire the brainbox to the second ethernet port of the radio so even if the limelight is down it won’t affect the connection to the rio. The rio ethernet connection will be to the POE port of the radio.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-03-31T03:27:50.677Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":370,"readers_count":369,"score":74.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":460770,"topic_slug":"more-comms-issues-but-in-a-different-flavor-of-frustrating","display_username":"m4nik1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31786,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/more-comms-issues-but-in-a-different-flavor-of-frustrating/460770/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3348226,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-31T03:30:49.136Z","cooked":"

Ensure the switch is powered by a VRM or other regulated power source. It may support down to 5V, but doesn’t seem to like variable voltage.

As others said, take the switch out of the critical path. Use the 2nd port of the radio for this.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-03-31T04:36:21.774Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":277,"readers_count":276,"score":90.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":460770,"topic_slug":"more-comms-issues-but-in-a-different-flavor-of-frustrating","display_username":"neev dadhania","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57670,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"204 programmer + electrical"},"post_url":"/t/more-comms-issues-but-in-a-different-flavor-of-frustrating/460770/10","custom_user_title":"204 programmer + electrical","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3348303,"name":"Abu","username":"a-star_algorithm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/a-star_algorithm/{size}/222022_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-31T08:40:01.712Z","cooked":"

We had a similar issue during practice matches at NVLV this year. We would lose communication for 30s-45s because our radio was resetting. We fixed it by replacing our RPM, radio, network switch, and every ethernet cable (overkill, but it worked).

It looks like you’re having an issue with the switch. Check the power to the switch, check for faulty ports, and check for faulty RJ45 cables. If none of this works, try replacing the network switch altogether.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-03-31T08:40:01.712Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":253,"readers_count":252,"score":60.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":460770,"topic_slug":"more-comms-issues-but-in-a-different-flavor-of-frustrating","display_username":"Abu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65532,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3216 | Team Captain & Programming"},"post_url":"/t/more-comms-issues-but-in-a-different-flavor-of-frustrating/460770/11","custom_user_title":"3216 | Team Captain & Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3348350,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-31T13:37:15.131Z","cooked":"

Check the power to your switch very carefully – there’s a little green plug with screw terminals, and the plug can come loose. If it looks as though the disconnects correlate with lower voltages or happen more often with certain batteries, consider putting a VRM or other power converter in the power path. Most of this still applies if you do swap out your switch.

In y’alls opinion, would a switch like this be good compared to a brainbox?

My team is having a similar problem so I talked with the CSA and FTA. They also showed me something from the log file that difinitively showed that the radio didn’t lose connection but connection to the RIO broke. However, I can’t replicate the view that showed the radio stayed constantly connected. Can someone tell me the steps so see the radio is connected even when the RIO isn’t? Prat42 you seemed to have this figured out since you say, “…We are constantly connected to the radio…”

You aren’t alone.

Brainbox Ethernet Switch Question / Match Issues Electrical
We are using an SW-005 network switch to connect our rio to our radio and limelight. This switch has a 3 pin electrical terminal block with V+, V-, and an Earth ground. We only wired up the Postiving/Negative to our PDH. While in our shop practice has been fine, but at an actual event on the real field we’re experiencing wild micro disconnect events where the robot disconnects 2-3 seconds at a time 10-20 times in a match. We’ve checked for any other source of the issue, but the thing that final…

Some folks have reported using a VRM makes the problem go away, but if you don’t then you are more likely to experience the issue.
